item.title: 美国取消对华出口限制，芯片设计软件公司业绩上升
item.description: 在美国取消对华芯片设计软件出口限制后，Synopsys 和 Cadence Design Systems 的股票在周四的盘前交易中大涨，这表明世界前两大经济体之间的贸易紧张局势已经解冻。【原文：Shares of Synopsys and Cadence Design Systems surged in premarket trade on Thursday after the United States lifted export restrictions on chip design software to China, signaling a thaw in trade tensions between the world's top two economies.】

item.title: 新日铁将为美国钢铁交易筹集 56 亿美元次级贷款
item.description: 日本新日铁公司周三表示，将通过两笔次级贷款融资 8000 亿日元（56 亿美元），为其最近斥资 149 亿美元收购美国钢铁公司提供部分资金，并为之前的贷款再融资。【原文：Japan's Nippon Steel said on Wednesday it would raise 800 billion yen ($5.6 billion) through two subordinated loans to partially fund its recent $14.9 billion acquisition of U.S. Steel and refinance previous loans.】

item.title: 解说：欧盟会推迟执行《人工智能法》吗？
item.description: 距离欧盟《人工智能法》部分条款生效还有不到一个月的时间，企业呼吁暂停实施这些条款，并得到了一些政界人士的支持。【原文：With less than a month to go before parts of the European Union's AI Act come into force, companies are calling for a pause in the provisions and getting support from some politicians.】

item.title: 印尼部长表示，印尼将在关税谈判截止日期前与美国合作伙伴签署价值 340 亿美元的协议
item.description: 印尼首席经济部长周四表示，印尼将于下周与商业伙伴签署一项价值 340 亿美元的协议，以促进从美国的采购，这是在 7 月 9 日最后期限之前与华盛顿达成贸易协议的努力的一部分。【原文：Indonesia will sign a pact worth $34 billion with business partners next week to boost purchases from the United States, as part of efforts to strike a trade deal with Washington ahead of the July 9 deadline, Indonesia's chief economic minister said on Thursday.】

item.title: 欧元区 6 月份服务业采购经理人指数显示服务业恢复温和增长
item.description: 周四的一项调查显示，欧元区占主导地位的服务业在经历了 5 月份的短暂萎缩后，于 6 月份恢复了增长，尽管商业信心有所改善，但由于需求依然疲软，增长速度仍然微弱。【原文：Growth in the euro zone's dominant services industry resumed in June after a brief contraction in May, though the pace remained marginal as demand remained weak despite improving business confidence, a survey showed on Thursday.】

item.title: 电动汽车制造商 Polestar 将在欧洲生产新车型
item.description: 总部位于瑞典的电动汽车制造商 Polestar 周四表示，其即将推出的 SUV 车型 Polestar 7 将在沃尔沃汽车位于斯洛伐克的在建工厂生产，这将是该公司首款在欧洲生产的汽车。【原文：Sweden-based electric vehicle maker Polestar said on Thursday its upcoming SUV model Polestar 7 will be manufactured at Volvo Cars' under-construction factory in Slovakia, making it its first car to be made in Europe.】

item.title: 美国众议院共和党人推进特朗普减税法案，为辩论开辟道路
item.description: 共和党控制的美国众议院周四推进了唐纳德-特朗普总统的全面减税和支出法案，这一程序性步骤为该法案可能在当天晚些时候的投票中获得通过创造了条件。【原文：The Republican-controlled U.S. House of Representatives on Thursday advanced President Donald Trump's sweeping tax-cut and spending bill, a procedural step setting the stage for possible passage of the legislation in a vote expected later in the day.】

item.title: 美国法院官员建议达利纳以 73.8 亿美元收购 Citgo 母公司
item.description: Gold Reserve 在周四的一份声明中说，负责监督委内瑞拉拥有的美国炼油商 Citgo Petroleum 母公司 PDV Holdings 拍卖的一名法院官员推荐 Gold Reserve 的子公司 Dalinar Energy 以 73.8 亿美元的价格竞拍。【原文：A court officer overseeing the auction for PDV Holdings, the parent of Venezuela-owned U.S. refiner Citgo Petroleum, has recommended Gold Reserve's subsidiary Dalinar Energy's $7.38 billion bid, Gold Reserve said in a statement on Thursday.】

item.title: 工会统计显示，日本企业创下 34 年来最大加薪幅度
item.description: 日本最大的工会组织 Rengo 周四表示，由于通货膨胀和劳动力短缺增加了继续加薪的压力，日本公司同意今年将工资提高 5.25%，这是 34 年来最大的一次加薪。【原文：Japanese companies agreed to raise wages by 5.25% this year, marking the biggest pay hike in 34 years, the country's largest labour union group Rengo said on Thursday, as inflation and labour shortages raise pressure for continued salary increases.】

item.title: 消息人士称，中国科技巨头为离岸人民币稳定币进行游说
item.description: 中国科技巨头 JD.com 和阿里巴巴关联公司蚂蚁金服集团正敦促央行批准基于人民币的稳定币，以对抗与美元挂钩的加密货币日益增长的影响力。【原文：China's tech giants JD.com and Alibaba affiliate Ant Group are urging the central bank to authorise yuan-based stablecoins to counter the growing sway of U.S. dollar-linked cryptocurrencies, people with direct knowledge of the discussions said.】

item.title: 消息人士称，亚航正在洽谈将部分现有空客订单转为远程喷气机订单的事宜
item.description: 两位业内消息人士称，亚航正在与空中客车公司谈判，将现有的一些窄体飞机订单转为远程A321XLR机型，以走出重组之路。【原文：AirAsia is in negotiations with Airbus to convert some existing narrow-body plane orders to the long-range A321XLR model as it sets a path out of restructuring, two industry sources said.】

item.title: 英国零售商瑞士手表预测年收入增长 6%-10
item.description: 英国奢侈品零售商瑞士手表公司（Watches of Switzerland）周四预计，在强劲的消费需求推动下，其美国业务收入将首次突破 10 亿美元大关，全年收入将增长 6% 至 10%。【原文：British luxury retailer Watches of Switzerland on Thursday projected full-year revenue growth of 6% to 10%, after its U.S. business revenue surpassed the $1 billion mark for the first time, driven by strong consumer demand.】

item.title: 阿克苏诺贝尔任命 Fredrik Westin 为下一任首席财务官
item.description: 多乐士涂料生产商阿克苏诺贝尔公司周四表示，已任命 Fredrik Westin 自 2026 年 1 月 1 日起担任公司首席财务官。【原文：Dulux paint maker Akzo Nobel said on Thursday it had appointed Fredrik Westin as its chief financial officer from January 1, 2026.】

item.title: 不断变化的趋势导致店铺关闭，香港零售商面临压力
item.description: 香港的零售商正在与消费习惯的转变作斗争，因为游客的消费减少，而本地人则越过边境前往中国寻找更便宜的餐饮和购物场所，这导致了一波商店倒闭潮。【原文：Hong Kong's retailers are battling against shifting consumer habits, as visitors spend less and locals head across the border to China for cheaper dining and shopping, leading to a wave of store closures.】

item.title: 桑坦德银行押注英国，与 TSB 达成交易，显示银行对规模的需求
item.description: 桑坦德银行以 26.5 亿英镑（约合 36.1 亿美元）收购 TSB 并提升其在英国地位的计划是几周前刚刚达成的，此前这家西班牙银行一直在权衡退出英国的可能性，三位接近这一进程的消息人士说。【原文：Santander's plan to buy TSB for 2.65 billion pounds ($3.61 billion) and boost its position in the UK came together just a few weeks ago, after the Spanish bank had been weighing a possible exit from Britain, three sources close to the process said.】

item.title: 瑞银储备经理调查称美联储独立性和美国法治面临风险
item.description: 瑞银资产管理公司（UBS Asset Management）周四在一项调查中称，每三位储备经理中就有两位担心美联储的独立性受到威胁，近一半的人认为美国的法治状况可能恶化到足以严重影响他们的资产配置。【原文：Two in three reserve managers fear Federal Reserve independence is at risk and nearly half think the rule of law in the United States may deteriorate enough to influence their asset allocation significantly, UBS Asset Management said in a survey on Thursday.】

item.title: 早间竞价贸易乐观让位于对美国就业的谨慎
item.description: Stella Qiu 对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Stella Qiu】

item.title: 日元交易引人注目，但也要付出代价
item.description: 由于央行的谨慎态度、贸易战和令人望而却步的持币成本，全球投资者正在解除对日元快速升值的押注，这也是今年最受欢迎的交易之一。【原文：Global investors are unwinding their wagers on Japan's yen rising quickly as a cautious central bank, a trade war and the prohibitive cost of holding the currency sour one of the year's most popular trades.】

item.title: 投资者做好准备，应对突发事件对市场造成的数周冲击
item.description: 这些事件可能会打破股市的平静，并导致他们认为可能出现正面或负面意外的资产（从黄金到企业信贷）大幅波动。【原文：Big investors are mobilising to trade through weeks packed with wild-card events that may shatter the calm in stock markets and drive big swings for assets they see as exposed to both positive or negative surprises, from gold to corporate credit.】

item.title: 美国 6 月就业增长预计放缓，失业率预计上升
item.description: 由于特朗普政府政策带来的经济不确定性抑制了招聘，6月份美国劳动力市场可能进一步放缓，失业率预计将升至4.3%，超过3年半以来的新高。【原文：The U.S. labor market likely slowed further in June, with the unemployment rate expected to have edged up to more than a 3-1/2-year high of 4.3%, as economic uncertainty stemming from the Trump administration's policies curbed hiring.】

item.title: 波音公司和司法部寻求法官批准遭空难遇难者家属反对的协议
item.description: 波音公司和美国司法部周三请求美国法官批准一项协议，尽管在2018年和2019年两起737 MAX坠机事故中遇难的346人中有一些人的亲属提出反对，但该协议允许波音公司避免被起诉。【原文：Boeing and the Justice Department on Wednesday asked a U.S. judge to approve an agreement that allows the company to avoid prosecution despite objections from relatives of some of the 346 people killed in two 737 MAX crashes in 2018 and 2019.】

item.title: 特斯拉 6 月在华电动车销量同比增长 3.7% 至 61,000 辆
item.description: 特斯拉中国公司周四公布的数据显示，特斯拉电动汽车 6 月份销量同比增长 3.7%。【原文：Tesla's electric vehicle sales in June rose 3.7% from a year earlier, according to Tesla China on Thursday.】

item.title: 日本央行决策者呼吁在暂时停止加息后恢复加息
item.description: 日本央行董事会成员高田恒指（Hajime Takata）表示，日本央行在为评估美国关税的影响而暂时停止加息后，应恢复加息，并对日本有望持久实现央行的物价目标表示乐观。【原文：The Bank of Japan should resume interest rate hikes following a temporary pause to evaluate the impact of U.S. tariffs, board member Hajime Takata said, signalling optimism the country was on track to durably achieve the central bank's price goal.】

item.title: 美国非农就业数据测试前亚洲股市上扬；特朗普的税收法案成为焦点
item.description: 周四，亚洲股市走高，原因是投资者在等待一份关键的美国就业报告，该报告可能为美联储即将降息提供理由，同时也在等待国会通过一项大规模的美国税收和支出法案。【原文：Asian shares edged higher on Thursday as investors braced for a key U.S. jobs report that may justify imminent rate cuts by the Federal Reserve and waited on the passage of a massive U.S. tax and spending bill in Congress.】

item.title: 美国取消出口限制后，Cadence 表示将恢复在中国的软件准入
item.description: 鏗騰設計系統公司（Cadence Design Systems）周四表示，美國已解除對中國芯片設計軟件的出口限制，該公司正在恢復受影響客戶對軟件和技術的使用。【原文：Cadence Design Systems said on Thursday the U.S. had lifted export restrictions on chip design software for China and that it was in the process of restoring access to software and technology to affected customers.】

item.title: 巴克莱银行调整亚太地区投资银行领导层，提升地区影响力
item.description: 巴克莱银行（Barclays）周四宣布了亚太地区投资银行部的一系列高管任命，旨在推动该地区的增长，同时在全球范围内审查该业务的资本分配。【原文：Barclays announced on Thursday a series of executive appointments within its Asia Pacific investment banking division, aiming to drive regional growth even as it globally reviews capital allocation to the business.】

item.title: 交易员翘首以待美国非农就业数据，美元随之漂移
item.description: 在7月9日关税最后期限到来之前，美国和越南之间达成的一项贸易协定助长了对未来可能达成的交易的乐观情绪，而投资者则将目光投向了薪资数据，以评估美联储的下一步行动。【原文：The dollar wobbled on Thursday after a trade agreement between the United States and Vietnam fuelled optimism over potential future deals ahead of a July 9 tariff deadline, while investors looked to payrolls to assess the Federal Reserve's next steps.】

item.title: 关键就业报告发布前，美国需求疲软的迹象导致石油下跌
item.description: 周四油价下跌，扭转了上一交易日的涨势，原因是政府数据显示全球最大的原油消费国美国的库存意外增加，市场担心美国需求疲软。【原文：Oil prices eased on Thursday, reversing gains from the previous session, on concerns over weak U.S. demand after government data showed a surprise build in inventories in the world's biggest crude consumer.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，西门子称美国已解除对中国的芯片软件禁令
item.description: 彭博新闻社（Bloomberg News）周三援引德国西门子公司的一份声明报道称，该公司已收到美国政府的通知，称对华芯片设计软件出口限制已被取消。【原文：Germany's Siemens AG has received a notice from the U.S. government saying that export restrictions on chip design software for China have been lifted, Bloomberg News reported on Wednesday, citing a statement from the company.】

item.title: 消息人士称，特朗普与越南达成协议后，美国和印度推动贸易协定的达成
item.description: 熟悉谈判情况的消息人士称，美国和印度的贸易谈判代表周三正在努力争取在唐纳德-特朗普总统规定的7月9日谈判截止日期之前达成一项降低关税的协议，但有关美国乳制品和农业的分歧仍未得到解决。【原文：U.S. and India trade negotiators were pushing on Wednesday to try to land a tariff-reducing deal ahead of President Donald Trump's July 9 negotiating deadline, but disagreements over U.S. dairy and agriculture remained unresolved, sources familiar with the talks said.】
